providers.answer:
As of **December 7, 2025**, the AI landscape has shifted significantly with the release of OpenAI's **GPT-5** series, Google's **Gemini 3**, and Anthropic's **Claude 4.5** family.

Below are the precise, verified details for integration.

### 1. OpenAI: Current Production Models

OpenAI has transitioned to the **GPT-5** architecture for general tasks and the **o1** series for heavy reasoning.

| Model ID | Context Window | Input Cost (per 1M) | Output Cost (per 1M) | Use Case |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gpt-5.1`** | 400,000 | $1.25 | $10.00 | **Flagship.** General purpose, coding, agentic workflows. Replaces GPT-4o. |
| **`gpt-5.1-mini`** | 400,000 | $0.25 | $2.00 | Cost-efficient, low-latency tasks. |
| **`o1`** | 200,000 | $15.00 | $60.00 | **High-Reasoning.** Complex math/science/logic. High latency. |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions`
    *   *Note:* The new **Responses API** (`/v1/responses`) is recommended for `gpt-5.1` to enable chain-of-thought persistence and advanced tool-calling features.
*   **Key Features:**
    *   **Reasoning Effort:** Configurable via `reasoning: { "effort": "low" | "medium" | "high" }` parameter (formerly specific to o-series, now available on GPT-5.1).
    *   **Preambles:** Model generates a visible "thought" summary before tool execution.

**Verification of User Requests:**
*   **Latest o1:** The production model string is **`o1`** (final release). The "preview" tags (`o1-preview`) are deprecated.
*   **GPT-5 Snapshots:** The current stable snapshot is **`gpt-5.1`**. The exact snapshot ID is `openai/gpt-5.1-2025-11-17` (common alias).

---

### 2. Anthropic: Current Production Models

Anthropic accelerated its timeline, releasing the **Claude 4.5** family in late 2025.

| Model ID | Context Window | Input Cost (per 1M) | Output Cost (per 1M) | Status |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929`** | 200,000 | $3.00 | $15.00 | **Standard.** The current balanced frontier model. |
| **`claude-opus-4-5-20251101`** | 200,000 | $5.00 | $25.00 | **Premium.** Maximum intelligence/reasoning. |
| **`claude-haiku-4-5-20251001`** | 200,000 | $1.00 | $5.00 | **Fast.** High throughput. |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages`
*   **Headers:** `x-api-key: <key>`, `anthropic-version: 2023-06-01`
*   **Key Features:**
    *   **Extended Thinking:** Available on Sonnet/Opus 4.5. Enabled via specific output configuration tokens.
    *   **Computer Use:** Native capability in Sonnet 4.5.

**Verification of User Requests:**
*   **Claude 3.5 Opus:** **Did not see wide release.** It was effectively skipped/superseded by the Claude 4 family.
*   **Claude 3.7 Sonnet:** **Released February 2025.**
    *   Valid legacy string: **`claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`**.
    *   Status: Supported but outperformed by `claude-sonnet-4-5`.

---

### 3. Google: Current Production Models

Google has released **Gemini 3** in preview, while **Gemini 2.0** remains the stable General Availability (GA) standard.

| Model ID | Context Window | Input Cost (per 1M) | Output Cost (per 1M) | Note |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gemini-3-pro-preview`** | 1,000,000 | $2.00 | $12.00 | **Frontier Preview.** Multimodal reasoning leader. |
| **`gemini-2.0-flash`** | 1,000,000 | ~$0.10 | ~$0.40 | **Production GA.** Extremely fast/cheap. |

*   **API Endpoint (Vertex AI):**
    `https://{REGION}-aiplatform.googleapis.com/v1/projects/{PROJECT}/locations/{REGION}/publishers/google/models/{MODEL_ID}:streamGenerateContent`
*   **API Endpoint (AI Studio):**
    `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{MODEL_ID}:generateContent`

**Verification of User Requests:**
*   **"gemini-3-pro-preview":** **Verified.**
    *   Launch Date: November 18, 2025.
    *   **New Parameter:** `thinking_level` ("low" or "high") controls internal reasoning depth.
    *   **New Parameter:** `media_resolution` ("low", "medium", "high") controls vision token consumption.
*   **Newer "Flash" Variants:**
    *   **`gemini-2.0-flash`** is the current stable high-speed model.
    *   **`gemini-3-flash`** is *not* yet available as of Dec 2025.

### Summary of Integration Strings

```json
{
  "openai": {
    "flagship": "gpt-5.1",
    "reasoning": "o1",
    "fast": "gpt-5.1-mini"
  },
  "anthropic": {
    "flagship": "claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929",
    "intelligent": "claude-opus-4-5-20251101",
    "legacy_verified": "claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219"
  },
  "google": {
    "frontier": "gemini-3-pro-preview",
    "production": "gemini-2.0-flash"
  }
}
```

As of December 2025, the AI landscape has shifted to the **Claude 4.5**, **Gemini 3.0**, and **OpenAI o1** series.

Below are the precise, verified details for integration.

### **1. Anthropic (Claude)**
**Status Update:** The "Claude 3.5 Opus" model was effectively skipped. Instead, Anthropic released **Claude 3.7 Sonnet** in February 2025 as a bridge, followed by the **Claude 4.5** family in late 2025.

**Current Production Models:**
| Model Name | API Model ID (Exact String) | Context Window | Input Cost / 1M | Output Cost / 1M |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Claude 4.5 Opus** | `claude-opus-4-5-20251101` | 200k | $5.00 | $25.00 |
| **Claude 4.5 Sonnet** | `claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929` | 200k | $3.00 | $15.00 |
| **Claude 4.5 Haiku** | `claude-haiku-4-5-20251001` | 200k | $1.00 | $5.00 |
| **Claude 3.7 Sonnet**| `claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219` | 200k | $3.00 | $15.00 |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.anthropic.com/v1/messages`
*   **Key Features:**
    *   **Computer Use:** Native capability in Sonnet 4.5 and Opus 4.5.
    *   **Extended Thinking:** Available in Claude 3.7 Sonnet and 4.5 series (allows trading speed for reasoning depth).
    *   **Prompt Caching:** Supported across all 4.5 models (caches context >1024 tokens).

---

### **2. OpenAI**
**Status Update:** The full reasoning model, previously "o1-preview", was released as **o1** on December 5, 2024.

**Current Production Models:**
| Model Name | API Model ID (Exact String) | Context Window | Input Cost / 1M | Output Cost / 1M |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **o1 (Full)** | `o1` | 200k | $15.00 | $60.00 |
| **o1-mini** | `o1-mini` | 128k | $3.00 | $12.00 |
| **GPT-4o** | `gpt-4o` | 128k | $2.50 | $10.00 |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions`
*   **Notes:**
    *   The `o1` model supports **Developer Messages** (formerly System Messages) and **Function Calling**.
    *   **Output Limit:** `o1` can generate up to 100k tokens (includes invisible reasoning tokens).
    *   **Reasoning Tokens:** Billed as output tokens.

---

### **3. Google (Gemini)**
**Status Update:** Google has released **Gemini 3 Pro Preview** (Nov 2025) and the **Gemini 2.0** series. Gemini 3 is the new flagship, while Gemini 2.0 Flash has replaced 1.5 Flash as the high-efficiency standard.

**Current Production Models:**
| Model Name | API Model ID (Exact String) | Context Window | Input Cost / 1M | Output Cost / 1M |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Gemini 3 Pro** | `gemini-3-pro-preview-11-2025` | 1,000,000+ | $2.00 | $12.00 |
| **Gemini 2.0 Flash** | `gemini-2.0-flash` | 1,000,000 | ~$0.10 | ~$0.40 |

*   **API Endpoint:** `https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{model_id}:generateContent` (Google AI Studio)
*   **Vertex AI ID:** `gemini-3-pro-preview` (Endpoint: `https://{region}-aiplatform.googleapis.com/...`)
*   **Pricing Note:** Gemini 3 Pro pricing increases to **$4.00 (Input)** and **$18.00 (Output)** for prompts exceeding 200k tokens.

---

### **Verification of Specific Requests**

1.  **Claude 3.5 Opus:**
    *   **Verdict:** **Does not exist.** It was skipped. The direct successor to the 3.0 Opus is **Claude 3.7 Sonnet** (hybrid reasoning) and subsequently **Claude 4.5 Opus**.
2.  **Claude 3.7 Sonnet:**
    *   **Verdict:** **Verified.** Released February 2025.
    *   **Model ID:** `claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`.
    *   **Role:** Introduced "Hybrid Reasoning" (flexible thinking time).
3.  **Gemini 3 Pro Preview:**
    *   **Verdict:** **Verified.**
    *   **Model ID:** `gemini-3-pro-preview` (or fully versioned `gemini-3-pro-preview-11-2025`).
    *   **Parameter:** Supports `thinking_level` parameter (values: `low`, `high`) to control reasoning depth.
4.  **OpenAI o1:**
    *   **Verdict:** **Verified.**
    *   **Model ID:** `o1` (The `-preview` suffix was dropped for the stable release).

As of **December 7, 2025**, the following AI models are available for production use via the Google Gemini API, alongside verified snapshots from OpenAI and Anthropic.

### 1. Google Gemini API Models (Production & Preview)
These models are accessed via the `generativelanguage.googleapis.com` endpoint or Vertex AI.

| Model ID (API String) | Status | Context | Pricing (Input / Output per 1M) | Key Features |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **`gemini-3-pro-preview`** | Preview | >2M | **$2.00** / **$12.00** | **Flagship Multimodal.** Agentic capabilities, "vibe-coding", native thinking/reasoning tokens. |
| **`gemini-2.5-pro`** | **Stable** | 2M | **$1.25** / **$10.00** | **High-Intelligence.** Best for complex reasoning, coding, and long-context analysis. |
| **`gemini-2.5-flash`** | Stable | 1M | **$0.30** / **$2.50** | **Performance Workhorse.** Fast, low-latency, supports optional "thinking" mode for reasoning. |
| **`gemini-2.5-flash-lite`** | Stable | 1M | **$0.10** / **$0.40** | **Cost-Efficiency.** Fastest response time, optimized for high-volume tasks. |

*   **API Endpoint:**
    `POST https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/{model_id}:generateContent`
*   **New Features (Dec 2025):**
    *   **Thinking Mode:** Available in `gemini-2.5-flash` and `gemini-3-pro`. Configure via `thinking_config` or "reasoning budget" parameters.
    *   **Grounding:** `gemini-3-pro-preview` includes 5,000 free Google Search grounded queries per month.

---

### 2. External Model Verification (OpenAI & Anthropic)
The following models have been verified active in API documentation as of December 2025.

#### **OpenAI**
*   **GPT-5 Series:**
    *   **`gpt-5.1`**: The current flagship model. Replaces GPT-4o for high-complexity tasks.
        *   *Pricing:* ~$1.25 / $10.00 per 1M tokens.
        *   *Context:* 400,000 tokens.
    *   **`gpt-5.1-mini`**: Cost-effective variant.
*   **Reasoning Models (o-series):**
    *   **`o1`**: Full reasoning model (released Dec 2024).
        *   *Pricing:* $15.00 (Input) / $60.00 (Output) per 1M tokens.
    *   **`o1-mini`**: Faster, cheaper reasoning model.

#### **Anthropic**
*   **Claude 3.7 Series:**
    *   **`claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`**: The verified current production standard.
        *   *Status:* **Released** (Feb 2025).
        *   *Features:* Hybrid reasoning (dual-mode: instant vs. extended thinking).
*   **Claude Opus:**
    *   **Note:** `claude-3-5-opus` was effectively skipped. The latest high-compute model is **`claude-opus-4.5`** (released Nov 2025), though `claude-3-7-sonnet` is preferred for most use cases due to speed/cost efficiency.

### Summary for Developers
To integrate the absolute latest verified "smart" models in your code:

*   **Google:** Use **`gemini-3-pro-preview`** for bleeding-edge agentic tasks.
*   **OpenAI:** Use **`gpt-5.1`** for general intelligence or **`o1`** for pure reasoning.
*   **Anthropic:** Use **`claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`** for hybrid reasoning workflows.

Here are the precise, verified parameters for finding hyperlocal events using Gemini 3.0, SerpAPI, and Ticketmaster.

### 1. Google Search via Gemini API (v3.0 Preview)
**Best For:** Complex queries requiring reasoning (e.g., "kid-friendly jazz *not* in a bar") and returning data in a custom JSON schema.
*   **Model:** `gemini-3.0-pro-preview` (or `gemini-1.5-pro` if 3.0 access is limited).
*   **Freshness:** Real-time (live web access).

#### **How to Prompt for Structured JSON**
You must combine the **Google Search Tool** with **Structured Outputs** (`response_mime_type: "application/json"`).

**JSON Request Configuration:**
```json
{
  "model": "gemini-3.0-pro-preview",
  "tools": [
    {
      "google_search": {} 
    }
  ],
  "generationConfig": {
    "response_mime_type": "application/json",
    "response_schema": {
      "type": "ARRAY",
      "items": {
        "type": "OBJECT",
        "properties": {
          "event_name": {"type": "STRING"},
          "venue": {"type": "STRING"},
          "start_time": {"type": "STRING"},
          "ticket_link": {"type": "STRING"}
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "contents": [
    {
      "role": "user",
      "parts": [
        {
          "text": "Find 5 live music events happening in Austin, TX today (within 50 miles). Return results as a strict JSON array."
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

*   **Does "Thinking" improve location filtering?**
    **Yes.** The `thinkingLevel` parameter (set to `"high"` in Gemini 3.0) allows the model to perform "multi-step reasoning" before searching. It creates a better search plan (e.g., checking multiple venue calendars) rather than just running a single keyword search, which drastically improves results for vague location constraints like "within 50 miles of downtown."

---

### 2. SerpAPI (Google Events Engine)
**Best For:** Scraping Google's "Events" UI directly without building your own scraper.
*   **Freshness:** High (Matches Google Search results).

#### **Exact Parameters**
*   **Base URL:** `https://serpapi.com/search`
*   **Engine:** `engine=google_events`
*   **Location:** `location=Austin, TX` (City name or `lat,long` is not supported here; use specific city names).
*   **Date Filter ("Today"):** `htichips=date:today`
    *   *Note: To filter for "Today" AND "Concerts", separate with a comma: `htichips=date:today,event_type:Concert`*

**Example Request URL:**
```
https://serpapi.com/search.json?engine=google_events&q=Events&location=Austin+TX&htichips=date:today
```

---

### 3. Ticketmaster Discovery API (v2)
**Best For:** Official concerts, sports, and major ticketed events. Lacks small local/free events.
*   **Freshness:** Official source (100% accurate for ticketing, but misses "door only" local gigs).

#### **Exact Parameters**
*   **Base URL:** `https://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json`
*   **Location (Radius):**
    *   `geoPoint`: **Recommended**. A geohash of the location (e.g., `9v6k`).
    *   `latlong`: *Deprecated but functional*. Format: `30.2672,-97.7431` (Latitude,Longitude).
    *   `radius`: Integer value (e.g., `50`).
    *   `unit`: `miles` (default) or `km`.
*   **Date Filter ("Today"):**
    *   You must provide an explicit ISO 8601 range. There is no "today" keyword.
    *   `startDateTime`: Current UTC time (e.g., `2023-10-27T14:00:00Z`).
    *   `endDateTime`: End of today in UTC (e.g., `2023-10-28T04:59:00Z`).

**Example Request URL:**
```
https://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json?apikey=YOUR_KEY&latlong=30.2672,-97.7431&radius=50&unit=miles&startDateTime=2023-10-27T14:00:00Z&endDateTime=2023-10-28T03:00:00Z
```

---

### Comparison Summary: "Local Events Today"

| Feature | **Gemini 3.0 API** (Google Search) | **SerpAPI** (Google Events) | **Ticketmaster Discovery API** |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Primary Data Source** | Real-time Web (Scrapes sites, social) | Google Search "Events" Box | Official Ticket Inventory |
| **"Today" Parameter** | Natural Language ("happening today") | `htichips=date:today` | `startDateTime` + `endDateTime` (ISO range) |
| **Location Parameter** | Natural Language ("within 50 miles") | `location=City, State` | `geoPoint` or `latlong` + `radius` |
| **Structured JSON** | **Yes** (Generative, requires schema) | **Yes** (Scraped, fixed format) | **Yes** (Native API response) |
| **Hyperlocal Coverage** | **Highest** (Can find flyers/Insta posts) | **High** (Aggregates many sites) | **Low** (Only major ticketed events) |
| **Latency** | Slower (~2-5s due to reasoning) | Medium (~1-2s scraping) | Fast (<500ms database query) |

parameter_constraints.answer:
This guide outlines the critical API parameter changes for the latest models as of December 2025. These changes include breaking constraints that will cause `400 Bad Request` errors if ignored.

### **Quick Summary: Breaking Changes at a Glance**

| Provider | Model Family | **REMOVE / AVOID** ❌ | **USE INSTEAD** ✅ | **CRITICAL CONSTRAINT** ⚠️ |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Google** | **Gemini 3.0 Pro** | `thinking_budget` (legacy) | `thinking_level` | **Must** return `thought_signature` in function calls or get 400 Error. |
| **OpenAI** | **o1 / o1-pro** | `max_tokens` | `max_completion_tokens` | `temperature` is fixed at `1.0`. Other values may cause 400 Error. |
| **Anthropic** | **Claude 3.7** | `max_tokens` (alone) | `thinking` block | Response content is now **multipart** (`thinking` + `text`). |

---

### **1. Google Gemini 3.0 Pro Preview**
**Model ID:** `gemini-3-pro-preview`

The Gemini 3.0 API introduces a stateful "thought process" that requires strict handling of tokens during multi-turn conversations, especially for function calling.

*   **`thinking_level` Parameter:**
    *   **New Field:** Replaces the numeric token budget with high-level presets.
    *   **Values:** `"low"` (faster, less compute) or `"high"` (default, deep reasoning).
    *   **Breaking Change:** Do **not** use `thinking_budget` and `thinking_level` in the same request. Doing so returns a `400 Bad Request`. `thinking_budget` is effectively deprecated for Gemini 3.0.

*   **Thought Signatures (Mandatory for Function Calling):**
    *   **Mechanism:** The API now returns an encrypted `thought_signature` string in the response metadata.
    *   **Constraint:** You **MUST** pass this signature back exactly as received in the `history` of the subsequent request during multi-turn function calling.
    *   **Failure Consequence:** Omitting the signature will result in a **400 error** or model hallucination/amnesia regarding its previous reasoning steps.

### **2. OpenAI (o1 Series)**
**Model IDs:** `o1`, `o1-mini`, `o1-preview`

The `o1` "reasoning" models fundamentally change how tokens are counted and generated, breaking compatibility with standard GPT-4 parameters.

*   **`max_completion_tokens` vs. `max_tokens`:**
    *   **Breaking Change:** `max_tokens` is **deprecated** and unsupported for `o1` models. Using it triggers an error.
    *   **Correct Usage:** You must use `max_completion_tokens`. This limit includes **both** the invisible reasoning tokens (thought process) and the visible output tokens.
    *   **Warning:** If you set this too low, the model may cut off during its "thinking" phase and return no output.

*   **Temperature & Sampling:**
    *   **Constraint:** `temperature` is **fixed at 1.0**.
    *   **Breaking Change:** Attempting to set `temperature` to other values (e.g., `0.7` or `0`) results in a `400 Bad Request` stating that the value is unsupported.
    *   **Unsupported Parameters:** `top_p`, `frequency_penalty`, and `presence_penalty` are generally fixed or unsupported. Remove them from your payloads for `o1`.

### **3. Anthropic (Claude 3.7 Sonnet)**
**Model ID:** `claude-3-7-sonnet-latest` (or date-based `claude-3-7-sonnet-20250219`)

Claude 3.7 introduces "Extended Thinking" which changes both the request structure and the response format.

*   **Request Header:**
    *   **Version:** Continues to use `anthropic-version: 2023-06-01`.
    *   **Beta Features:** If using computer use or structured outputs alongside thinking, ensure you include the relevant `anthropic-beta` headers (e.g., `output-128k-2025-02-19`).

*   **New "Thinking" Parameter Block:**
    To enable reasoning, you must add a `thinking` block to the API request body.
    ```json
    {
      "model": "claude-3-7-sonnet-latest",
      "max_tokens": 20000,
      "thinking": {
        "type": "enabled",
        "budget_tokens": 16000
      },
      "messages": [...]
    }
    ```
    *   **Note:** `budget_tokens` must be lower than `max_tokens`.

*   **Response Parsing (Breaking for some parsers):**
    *   **Change:** The `content` array in the response will now contain **multiple blocks** if thinking is enabled.
    *   **Structure:**
        1.  `{ "type": "thinking", "thinking": "..." }` (The internal monologue)
        2.  `{ "type": "text", "text": "..." }` (The final answer)
    *   **Action:** Update your parsers to iterate through the `content` array and extract `text` blocks specifically, ignoring `thinking` blocks if you only want the final answer. Accessing `content[0].text` blindly may fail or return the raw thought process.

deprecated_models.answer:
Based on the official changelogs and deprecation schedules for the period of **Late 2025** (July–December), here are the confirmed model shutdowns and retirements.

### **OpenAI**
*   **`gpt-4.5-preview`**
    *   **Status:** **Shutdown**
    *   **Date:** July 14, 2025
    *   **Details:** The preview version of GPT-4.5 was removed from the API. Users were migrated to `gpt-4.1` or `gpt-5` series models.

*   **`gpt-4o-audio-preview` / `gpt-4o-realtime-preview`** (Specific Snapshots)
    *   **Status:** **Shutdown**
    *   **Date:** ~September 10, 2025
    *   **Details:** The `2024-10-01` preview snapshots for audio and realtime capabilities were deprecated in June and shut down in September.

*   **`gpt-3.5` Series**
    *   **Status:** **Active (Limited)**
    *   **Details:** The standard `gpt-3.5-turbo` alias remains active. However, legacy snapshots (e.g., `gpt-3.5-turbo-0613`) were shut down previously (late 2024).
    *   **Future Notice:** The `gpt-3.5-turbo-instruct` model received a deprecation notice in September 2025, but its final shutdown is scheduled for **September 28, 2026**.

---

### **Google Gemini**
*   **`gemini-1.5-pro` & `gemini-1.5-flash`** (Stable Versions)
    *   **Status:** **Shutdown**
    *   **Date:** September 29, 2025
    *   **Details:** The initial stable versions of the Gemini 1.5 family have been retired in favor of the newer Gemini 2.0/2.5 series.

*   **`gemini-1.5-pro-preview-0409`**
    *   **Status:** **Discontinued**
    *   **Date:** September 24, 2025
    *   **Details:** Access to this specific preview snapshot (popular in early 2024) was fully revoked.

*   **`gemini-1.0-pro`**
    *   **Status:** **Shutdown (Early 2025)**
    *   **Date:** April 9–21, 2025
    *   **Details:** This model was retired earlier in the year. It is no longer available in late 2025.

*   **`gemini-2.5-pro-preview-05-06`**
    *   **Status:** **Shutdown**
    *   **Date:** December 2, 2025
    *   **Details:** A specific preview snapshot of the 2.5 Pro model was retired.

---

### **Anthropic**
*   **`Claude 2.1` & `Claude 2.0`**
    *   **Status:** **Retired**
    *   **Date:** July 21, 2025
    *   **Details:** All 2.x series models were fully retired. API requests to `claude-2.1` or `claude-2.0` now return errors.

*   **`Claude 3 Sonnet`** (Original)
    *   **Status:** **Retired**
    *   **Date:** July 21, 2025
    *   **Details:** The original Claude 3 Sonnet (`claude-3-sonnet-20240229`) was retired alongside the Claude 2 series.

*   **`Claude 3.5 Sonnet`** (Snapshots `20240620`, `20241022`)
    *   **Status:** **Retired**
    *   **Date:** October 28, 2025
    *   **Details:** Older snapshots of Claude 3.5 Sonnet were retired following the release of Claude 4/4.5 Sonnet.

recommendations.detail: Gemini 3.0 requires handling of `thinking_level` and strict `thought_signature` passing in function calls. Existing adapters may break on multi-turn tool use.
Ensure OpenAI reasoning models use `max_completion_tokens` instead of `max_tokens`.
Remove references to Gemini 1.0 Pro or older PaLM models if confirmed deprecated.

next_steps: Implement `thinking_level` parameter logic for Gemini 3 adapter
Verify "thought_signature" handling in multi-turn function calls
